job_description.overview:
About Acme Technologies:
Acme Technologies is a Series B startup backed by leading venture capital firms. We're building the next generation of business operations software, serving over 500 enterprise customers. Our team of 150 people is passionate about solving complex problems and creating delightful user experiences.

Role Overview:
We are seeking a talented Product Manager to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for driving product strategy, working with cross-functional teams, and delivering exceptional products that delight our customers. You will own the product roadmap and work closely with engineering, design, marketing, and sales to bring innovative solutions to market.

This role is perfect for someone who is passionate about SaaS platforms for enterprise operations management and wants to make a significant impact on our product direction and company growth.
responsibilities: Lead product strategy and vision for key product areas
Own and manage product roadmap, prioritizing features based on business impact
Conduct user research and market analysis to identify opportunities
Work closely with engineering teams to define technical requirements and specifications
Drive go-to-market strategy in collaboration with marketing and sales teams
Define and track key product metrics and success criteria
Present product updates and strategic recommendations to executive leadership
Mentor junior product managers and contribute to PM practice development
Lead cross-functional initiatives and drive alignment across teams
Drive product strategy for our enterprise operations platform
Partner with our largest customers to understand their needs
Lead cross-functional initiatives across product, engineering, design, and go-to-market teams
Own product strategy and roadmap for mobile applications
Collaborate with engineering, design, and marketing teams

required: Lead product strategy and vision for key product areas
Own and manage product roadmap, prioritizing features based on business impact
Conduct user research and market analysis to identify opportunities
Work closely with engineering teams to define technical requirements and specifications
Drive go-to-market strategy in collaboration with marketing and sales teams
Define and track key product metrics and success criteria
Present product updates and strategic recommendations to executive leadership
Mentor junior product managers and contribute to PM practice development
Lead cross-functional initiatives and drive alignment across teams
7+ years of product management experience in B2B SaaS
Proven track record of launching successful enterprise products
Strong technical background with ability to work closely with engineering teams
preferred: Experience at fast-growing Series B-D startups
Domain expertise in operations management or ERP systems
experience with consumer apps, strong data analysis skills, and a track record of successful product launches

experience with a/b testing and product analytics
- excellent stakeholder management
- experience with agile development

technical: Data analysis and metrics-driven decision making
SQL or similar data query languages
Analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude)

benefits: Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance (100% coverage for employees)

application_process.how_to_apply: Please submit your resume, a cover letter explaining your interest in Acme Technologies, and a brief write-up describing a product you've shipped and the impact it had.
application_process.equal_opportunity: We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
application_process.accommodations: If you need accommodations during the application process, please let us know.

hiring_strategy.overview:
This hiring plan outlines the strategy for hiring 1 Senior Product Manager(s).
The plan focuses on attracting top talent through a multi-channel sourcing approach, rigorous
evaluation process, and competitive compensation packages.
key_priorities: Balance speed with quality of hire

background: Senior PMs from top tech companies or successful startups
Track record of driving significant business impact
experience: Led product strategy for major product lines

value_proposition: Opportunity to make significant impact on product direction
Work with cutting-edge technology and talented team
Flexible work environment and strong culture
differentiators: Work on products used by Fortune 500 companies
High-growth startup with proven product-market fit
Strong engineering culture with latest technologies
Direct access to leadership and ability to shape company direction
Competitive compensation with significant equity upside

goals: Build diverse interview panel representing different backgrounds
Source from diverse talent pools and communities
Remove bias from job descriptions and screening process
Track diversity metrics throughout hiring funnel
Partner with organizations supporting underrepresented groups in tech
diversity_and_inclusion.targets: Aim for 50% diverse candidate slate at each interview stage

channels.name: Employee Referrals
activities: Launch internal referral campaign with incentives
Brief team on ideal candidate profile
Provide easy referral submission process
Track and acknowledge all referrals within 48 hours

channels.name: Direct Sourcing/Outreach
activities: LinkedIn Recruiter searches with targeted criteria
Engage passive candidates with personalized messages
Leverage GitHub, ProductHunt, and Medium for active PMs
Attend industry events and conferences

channels.name: Job Boards
activities: Post on LinkedIn, Indeed, Glassdoor
Use specialized boards: AngelList, ProductHQ, MindTheProduct
Optimize job postings for SEO and discoverability
Monitor and respond to applications within 24 hours

channels.name: Recruiting Agencies
activities: Partner with 2-3 specialized PM recruiting firms
Provide detailed candidate profile and expectations
Set clear SLAs for candidate submission and feedback
Review agency performance monthly

channels.name: PM Communities
activities: Engage with PM Slack groups and forums
Sponsor/speak at PM meetups and events
Create valuable content to attract candidates
Build relationships with PM influencers

responsibilities: Define role requirements and ideal candidate profile
Review all candidates before final rounds
Conduct final interviews
Make hiring decisions and extend offers
Participate in sourcing and outreach for senior roles
Manage sourcing and candidate pipeline
Conduct initial screening calls
Coordinate interview scheduling
Communicate with candidates throughout process
Track metrics and provide weekly updates
Conduct structured interviews using rubrics
Provide timely feedback within 24 hours
Participate in debrief sessions
Help with candidate engagement and selling
Schedule all interviews
Send preparation materials to candidates
Coordinate logistics for on-site/virtual interviews
Collect interview feedback
Support offer process

efficiency_metrics.time_to_hire: Target: <60 days from job posting to offer acceptance
efficiency_metrics.time_to_fill: Target: <90 days from requisition approval to start date

quality_metrics.cultural_fit: Measured in performance reviews and 360 feedback

pipeline_metrics.candidate_pipeline_health: Maintain 3:1 ratio of candidates to open roles
pipeline_metrics.source_effectiveness: Track conversion rate by source channel
pipeline_metrics.diversity_metrics: Track diversity at each stage of funnel

reporting_cadence.weekly: Pipeline status, candidate flow, upcoming interviews
reporting_cadence.bi_weekly: Detailed funnel metrics and source analysis
reporting_cadence.monthly: Full metrics dashboard and strategy review

risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Develop strong employer brand, competitive compensation, fast decision-making process, and compelling growth opportunities

risks_and_mitigations.risk: Extended time to hire leads to losing candidates
risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Streamline interview process, set clear timelines, maintain regular candidate communication, expedite internal approvals
Multi-channel sourcing approach, build talent community, start sourcing before opening is approved, leverage employee networks

risks_and_mitigations.risk: Poor candidate experience damages employer brand
risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Timely communication, respectful interview process, gather and act on candidate feedback, personalized interactions
Block recurring interview time slots, train backup interviewers, use asynchronous assessment tools where appropriate
Maintain interview standards regardless of urgency, use structured interviews and rubrics, involve multiple interviewers
Research market rates, understand candidate expectations early, have flexibility in comp structure, highlight total comp package

risks_and_mitigations.risk: Limited pool of qualified senior candidates
risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Start outreach to passive candidates early, consider candidates from adjacent industries, build relationships over time

interview_process_overview.typical_duration: 3-4 weeks from first contact to offer
interview_process_overview.decision_criteria: Must receive strong "hire" recommendation from majority of interviewers, with no strong "no hire" signals
process_principles: Structured and consistent evaluation across all candidates
Multiple perspectives from cross-functional team members
Focus on predictive indicators of success

key_questions: Walk me through your PM experience and key accomplishments
What interests you about this role and our company?
Describe your experience with product roadmap development
Tell me about your experience working with engineering teams
What are your salary expectations?
What is your timeline and are you interviewing elsewhere?

signals_to_look_for: Has required years of PM experience
Genuine interest in role and company
Has done research on the company

red_flags: Lacks basic knowledge about the company
interview_stages.next_steps: If positive, advance to product sense interview

objectives: Test user empathy and customer focus
key_questions: Describe your product vision for [our product category]. How would you differentiate from competitors?
Walk me through how you would build a product strategy for entering [new market]
Tell me about a time you had to pivot product direction. How did you decide?
How do you balance short-term wins with long-term product vision?
Design the next generation of [product category]. What would you build and why?

signals_to_look_for: Demonstrates strong understanding of user needs
Asks clarifying questions about users and context
Thinks about market positioning and competition
Connects product decisions to business outcomes

scoring_dimensions.User Understanding: How well does candidate understand user needs and pain points?
scoring_dimensions.Product Vision: Can they articulate a compelling product direction?
scoring_dimensions.Strategic Thinking: Do they connect product decisions to business strategy?
scoring_dimensions.Creativity: Do they generate novel and valuable ideas?
scoring_dimensions.Trade-off Analysis: Can they evaluate options and make decisions?

what_great_looks_like: Asks insightful questions to understand context
Shows passion for products and problem-solving
red_flags: Jumps to solutions without understanding problem
Focuses only on features without considering outcomes
Lacks creativity or only proposes obvious ideas

objectives: Assess ability to ship products on time
Test project management and organizational skills
key_questions: Describe your approach to building and managing a product roadmap
Tell me about a time you had to coordinate a complex, cross-functional initiative
How do you balance multiple competing priorities from different stakeholders?
Walk me through how you use data to make product decisions
Describe your experience with A/B testing and experimentation

signals_to_look_for: Track record of shipping products on time
Ability to break down complex projects
Understands basic statistics and A/B testing
Can interpret data and draw insights

scoring_dimensions.Shipping Track Record: Do they have a history of delivering results?
scoring_dimensions.Analytical Thinking: Can they define and use metrics effectively?
scoring_dimensions.Process & Organization: Are they structured and organized in their approach?
scoring_dimensions.Cross-functional Collaboration: Can they work effectively with different teams?
scoring_dimensions.Bias for Action: Do they move quickly and decisively?

red_flags: Cannot provide examples of shipped products
Vague or no understanding of metrics

objectives: Evaluate ability to work with engineers
Test understanding of system design concepts
Assess API and data model understanding
key_questions: Explain the technical architecture of a product you've worked on
How do you make technical trade-off decisions?
Design the technical architecture for [product/feature]
How would you explain [technical concept] to a non-technical stakeholder?
Tell me about a time you had a technical disagreement with engineering. How did you handle it?
What questions do you ask engineers when scoping a new feature?
How do you evaluate technical debt vs. new features?

signals_to_look_for: Understands technical concepts relevant to role
Knows enough to make informed decisions
Can evaluate build vs. buy decisions

interview_stages.note: Technical bar should be appropriate for experience level - not expecting engineers, but need to be credible technical partner
red_flags: No understanding of basic technical concepts
Cannot explain technical aspects of previous work

objectives: Evaluate ability to influence without authority
Test mentorship and people development skills
Assess strategic influence at senior levels
key_questions: Tell me about your leadership philosophy
Describe a time you had to influence a decision without having authority
How do you develop and mentor other PMs?
Tell me about a time you led a major organizational change
How do you build alignment across senior leadership?
Describe a situation where you had to make an unpopular decision
How do you create a culture of excellence in product management?
Tell me about a time you had to course-correct a team or project

scoring_dimensions.Influence: Can they drive decisions across the organization?
scoring_dimensions.Strategic Impact: Do they operate at the right level of strategy?
scoring_dimensions.People Development: Do they grow and develop others?

red_flags: No examples of leadership or influence
Does not invest in people development

key_questions: Tell me about a time you failed. What did you learn?
Describe a situation where you had conflict with a colleague. How did you resolve it?
Tell me about a time you had to adapt to significant change
Describe your ideal work environment and team culture
What are you passionate about outside of work?
Tell me about a time you gave difficult feedback to someone
Describe a situation where you had to work with someone very different from you
What does diversity and inclusion mean to you in practice?
Tell me about a time you went above and beyond
What are you looking for in your next role and why?

scoring_dimensions.Cultural Alignment: Will they thrive in our culture?
scoring_dimensions.Values Match: Do they demonstrate our core values?
scoring_dimensions.Collaboration Style: Will they work well with the team?
scoring_dimensions.Motivation: Are they motivated by the right things?

objectives: Evaluate strategic thinking at highest level
Executive-level sell of role and company
key_questions: Why are you interested in this role and our company?
Where do you see yourself in 3-5 years?
What do you think our biggest product challenges are?
How would you approach your first 90 days?
What questions do you have for me?
What would make you excited to join our company?
Tell me about the most impactful thing you've done in your career
What's your take on [industry trend or company strategic direction]?

signals_to_look_for: Has informed perspective on company direction
Genuinely excited about company and role
Clear alignment with mission and values
Will stay and grow with company

interviewer_focus: Sell candidate on opportunity and vision
red_flags: Not well prepared or knowledgeable about company

rating_scale.Strong Hire: Exceptional candidate. Top 5% of candidates. Multiple areas of excellence. No significant weaknesses.
rating_scale.Hire: Strong candidate. Meets all requirements with some areas of strength. Minor weaknesses that are not deal-breakers.
rating_scale.Maybe: Borderline candidate. Mixed signals. Has strengths but also concerns. Needs discussion.
rating_scale.No Hire: Does not meet bar. Significant gaps or concerns. Would not be successful in role.

decision_making.hiring_decision: Must have majority "Hire" or "Strong Hire" ratings across all interviewers
decision_making.veto_power: Any "Strong No Hire" from an interviewer triggers team discussion
decision_making.debrief_process: Hold structured debrief with all interviewers before making decision
decision_making.timeline: Make decision within 48 hours of final interview

how_to_score: Compare to bar for the role level
Consider both what they did and how they did it
writing_feedback: Provide specific examples to support rating
Include both strengths and areas of concern
Note any red flags or exceptional signals
avoiding_bias: Evaluate candidate against role requirements, not other candidates
calibration: Attend interviewer training and calibration sessions
Review examples of strong vs. weak answers

before_interview: Read feedback from previous interview rounds
Prepare your questions using the rubric
during_interview: Start with warm welcome and role overview
Probe for specific examples using STAR method
Leave time for candidate questions (10-15 minutes)
after_interview: Include specific examples for your rating
Submit feedback before seeing others' input
Provide timely response to recruiting team

star_method.action: What did the candidate specifically do?
star_method.result: What was the outcome? What was learned?

interview_best_practices: Listen more than you talk (80/20 rule)
Don't lead the witness - ask open-ended questions
Provide positive candidate experience regardless of outcome

principles: Treat every candidate with respect and professionalism
Communicate clearly and timely at every stage
Make the process efficient and organized
Provide transparency about process and timeline
Give candidate opportunity to put their best foot forward
Provide closure and feedback when appropriate

before_each_interview: Send calendar invite with video link or location
Provide interviewer name, title, and LinkedIn
Share what to expect in the interview
Send any prep materials or case studies in advance
materials_to_share: Overview of interview process and timeline
Information about the team and role
Recent news or blog posts about company

making_it_positive: Send thank you note after interview

objectives: Set up interview process and rubrics
Set up job postings and sourcing channels
phases.success_criteria: Ready to begin active sourcing and screening
Strong pipeline of qualified candidates ready for interviews
Strong finalist slate advanced to final rounds

objectives: Hold team debrief and make decisions
phases.success_criteria: Ready to extend offers to top candidate(s)
Offer accepted and candidate ready to start

milestones.description: Job description finalized and posted on all channels
Initial batch of recruiter screens completed
First candidates move to interview stage
Strong finalists identified for final rounds
All final interviews and reference checks done
Candidate accepts offer and signs paperwork

key_activities: Brief hiring team and train interviewers
Post job on LinkedIn, company site, and job boards
Continue sourcing candidates via multiple channels
Post in PM communities and networks
Identify candidates for first round interviews
metrics_to_track: Pipeline health: ratio of candidates to roles

key_activities: Continue sourcing candidates via multiple channels
Post in PM communities and networks
Identify candidates for first round interviews
metrics_to_track: Pipeline health: ratio of candidates to roles

key_activities: Schedule and conduct product sense interviews
Hold debrief sessions for each candidate
Schedule and conduct product sense interviews
Hold debrief sessions for each candidate
Schedule and conduct product sense interviews
Hold debrief sessions for each candidate
Schedule and conduct product sense interviews
Hold debrief sessions for each candidate
Conduct behavioral and culture fit interviews
Hold final debrief and make decisions
Prepare offer packages and get approvals
Conduct behavioral and culture fit interviews
Hold final debrief and make decisions
Prepare offer packages and get approvals
Schedule offer call with hiring manager

dependencies.impact: Cannot start interviews without screened candidates
Need to identify finalists before final rounds
Must complete due diligence before offer
Limited interview slots can slow process

interview_panel_time.note: Stagger to avoid overwhelming individual interviewers

risk_timeline.mitigation: Complete all prep work before official start date
Multi-channel sourcing, start early, leverage referrals
Block recurring interview slots, train backup interviewers

risk_timeline.impact: Need to restart with new candidates
risk_timeline.mitigation: Maintain warm pipeline, move quickly, stay engaged
risk_timeline.buffer: Keep multiple candidates moving through process

risk_timeline.mitigation: Discuss comp early, understand expectations, have flexibility
Use reputable background check vendor, initiate immediately

daily: Recruiter checks pipeline and responds to applications

candidate_communication.rejection: Personalized note with feedback where appropriate

stakeholder_updates.monthly: Full metrics and strategy review with leadership
stakeholder_updates.issues: Immediate escalation of any blockers or risks
